vulnerabilities.title: Vditor allows Cross-site Scripting via an attribute of an `A` element
vulnerabilities.description:
Vditor 3.10.3 allows XSS via an attribute of an `A` element.

NOTE: the vendor indicates that a user is supposed to mitigate this via `sanitize=true`.

vulnerabilities.title: vditor Vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting in SVG events
vulnerabilities.description: vditor does not filter user input in SVG events, leading to XSS ### PoC ```html

vulnerabilities.title: Vditor Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: Vditor is a browser-side Markdown editor. Versions prior to 3.8.7 are vulnerable to copy-paste cross-site scripting (XSS). For this particular type of XSS, the victim needs to be fooled into copying a malicious payload into the text editor. Version 3.8.7 contains a patch for this issue.

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-site Scripting in vditor
vulnerabilities.description: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in GitHub repository vanessa219/vditor prior to 3.8.13.

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-site Scripting in vditor
vulnerabilities.description: vditor prior to version 3.8.11 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting.
